isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Install the auxiliary mainshaft between the auxiliary countershafts with the synchronizer assembly down. Line the timing marks on each countershaft with the LO range gear and the reduction gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 248).

figure.caption: Figure 248. Line Timing Marks on Each Countershaft With LO Range Gear and Reduction Gear

step1.para: Install the reduction yoke in the sliding clutch on the output shaft. Install the range yoke in the synchronizer sliding clutch as shown ( Figure 249).

figure.caption: Figure 249. Install Range Yoke in Synchronizer Sliding Clutch
Figure 250. Cylinder Assembly Exploded View

step1.para: Place the auxiliary housing on a flat surface. Install the complete bearing race in the auxiliary housing bearing bore ( Figure 251).

figure.caption: Figure 251. Install Complete Bearing Race in Auxiliary Housing Bearing Bore

step1.para: Temporarily install the rear bearing cover with 2 bolts ( Figure 252).

figure.caption: Figure 252. Temporarily Install Rear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Place the auxiliary housing assembly over the output shaft ( Figure 253).

figure.caption: Figure 253. Place Auxiliary Housing Assembly Over Output Shaft

step1.para: If previously removed, apply silicon lubricant to the range cylinder and the reduction cylinder O-rings. Install the range cylinder O-ring in the range cylinder bore ( Figure 254).

figure.caption: Figure 254. Install Range Cylinder O-Ring

step1.para: Install the reduction cylinder O-ring in the reduction cylinder bore ( Figure 255).

figure.caption: Figure 255. Install Reduction Cylinder O-Ring

step1.para: Install the cylinder gasket on the auxiliary housing. Lubricate both yoke bars with silicon lubricant. Install the cylinder assembly housing in the auxiliary case ( Figure 256), and pilot the range yoke bar and the reduction yoke bar through the cylinder bores.

figure.caption: Figure 256. Install Cylinder Assembly Housing in Auxiliary Case

step1.para: If previously removed, install the O-rings in the range piston I.D. and O.D. and lubricate the O-rings with silicon lubricant ( Figure 257).

figure.caption: Figure 257. Install O-Rings in Range Piston I.D. and O.D.

step1.para: Install the range piston on the range yoke bar, flat side to the rear ( Figure 258).

figure.caption: Figure 258. Install Range Piston on Range Yoke Bar

step1.para: Install the 15/16 inch nut and tighten to the recommended torque ( Figure 259).

figure.caption: Figure 259. Install Nut and Tighten

step1.para: If previously removed, install the O-ring on the reduction piston O.D. and lubricate the O-ring with silicon lubricant ( Figure 260).

figure.caption: Figure 260. Install O-Ring on Reduction Piston O.D.

step1.para: Install the reduction piston on the reduction yoke bar with the flat side to the rear ( Figure 261).

figure.caption: Figure 261. Install Reduction Piston on Reduction Yoke Bar

step1.para: Install the 3/4 inch nut and tighten to the recommended torque ( Figure 262).

figure.caption: Figure 262. Install Nut and Tighten

step1.para: If necessary, replace the air fittings on the cylinder cover ( Figure 263).

figure.caption: Figure 263. Replace Air Fittings on Cylinder Cover

step1.para: If previously removed, install the insert valve with the flat side to the inside ( Figure 264).

figure.caption: Figure 264. Install Insert Valve

step1.para: If previously removed, install and tighten the insert valve retaining nut to the recommended torque ( Figure 265).

figure.caption: Figure 265. Install and Tighten Insert Valve Retaining Nut

step1.para: Install the cylinder cover gasket and the cylinder cover and tighten the 5 bolts to the recommended torque ( Figure 266).

figure.caption: Figure 266. Install Cylinder Cover Gasket and Cylinder Cover

step1.para: Install the countershaft bearing race, with the tapered side down, into the auxiliary bore ( Figure 267).

figure.caption: Figure 267. Install Countershaft Bearing Race

step1.para: Install a .100 gauging shim, from the helical shim kit, in each countershaft rear bearing shim bore ( Figure 268). Be sure the countershaft rear bearing races are seated in the bearing bores.

figure.caption: Figure 268. Install Gauging Shim in Each Countershaft Rear Bearing Shim Bore

step1.para: Install an auxiliary countershaft retaining strap with 2 bolts that were removed from the auxiliary countershaft bearing covers ( Figure 269).

figure.caption: Figure 269. Install Auxiliary Countershaft Retaining Strap

step1.para: Install a 3/8 inch x 2-1/2 inch bolt through the auxiliary countershaft retaining strap center ( Figure 270) and thread the bolt into the auxiliary countershaft. Repeat steps 19 through 22 for the other countershaft. Make sure the reduction gears stay in time.

figure.caption: Figure 270. Install Bolt Through Auxiliary Countershaft Retaining Strap Center

caution.para: Do not use an air gun. Tighten only until bolts are snug.

step1.para: Remove the rear bearing cover and install the bearing inner spacer on the output shaft ( Figure 271).

figure.caption: Figure 271. Install Bearing Inner Spacer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Heat the rear bearing cone and install on the output shaft, taper side down and inside the bearing cup ( Figure 272).

figure.caption: Figure 272. Install Rear Bearing Cone on Output Shaft

note.para: Do not heat the bearing above 275°F (136°C). If possible, use heat lamps as a source.

step1.para: Position the gasket on the mounting surface and install the rear bearing cover on the auxiliary housing. Tighten the bolts to the recommended torque ( Figure 273).

figure.caption: Figure 273. Install Rear Bearing Cover on Auxiliary Housing

step1.para: Install the speedometer drive gear or spacer in position on the output shaft ( Figure 274).

figure.caption: Figure 274. Install Speedometer Drive Gear or Spacer in Position on Output Shaft

step1.para: Install the output yoke on the output shaft splines. Install the washer and nut and tighten the nut to the recommended torque ( Figure 275).

figure.caption: Figure 275. Install Output Yoke on Output Shaft Splines
